DataElement.preferredName: Patient Antibody Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient meets the antibody therapy criteria in order to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Antibody Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to patient receiving treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Antibody Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment with an antibody, a substance that can directly kill specific tumor cells or stimulate the immune system to kill tumor cells.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with injections of antibodies to directly destroy specific, usually cancerous, cells or to stimulate the immune system to destroy those cells.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has received prior therapy wi
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CD137, ziv-aflibercept or anti-CTLA-4 antibody (including ipilimumab or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any therapy on the PD-1/PD-L1 axis or anti-CTLA-4 inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has not received prior treatment with anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2 antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease that is documented to be refractory to at least one PD1/PD-L1 inhibitor, defined as disease progression following at least 2 infusions of the same drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with any PARP inhibitor or any anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has bisphosphonate, or RANKL antibody therapy been initiated or the dose/regimen adjusted within 30 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 or anti-CTLA-4 therapeutic antibody or pathway-targeting agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 antibody, anti-PD 1 antibody or anti-PDL1 antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-PD-1, or anti-PD-L1 therapeutic antibody or pathway-targeting agents are following requirements  met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has not received prior anti-PD-1 or ant-PD-L1 therapy after ACT and before study atezolizumab (MPDL3280A) administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any therapy on the PD-1/PD-L1 axis or anti-CTLA-4 inhibitors, unless enrolling the urothelial carcinoma with previous checkpoint inhibition therapy expansion cohort?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with any anti-PD-1 blocking therapies or HDACi, or anti-CTLA-4 antibody, CD137 agonist or other immune activating therapy such as anti-CD 40 antibody within the last 3 months of enrollment in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CD137, or ziv-aflibercept?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD1 or anti-CTLA4 therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 or pathway-targeting agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient has prior exposure to immune mediated therapy including anti-CTLA-4 agent, but excluding therapeutic anticancer vaccines and anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy in NSCLC patients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior exposure to immune mediated therapy including anti-CTLA-4 agent, but excluding therapeutic anticancer vaccines and anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy in NSCLC patients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient greater than or equal to 15 weeks since prior anti-CD137 or anti-CTLA-4 (including ipilimumab or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received checkpoint inhibitors such as anti-CTLA-4 or anti-PD1/PD-L1 and for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C within 6 weeks prior to C1D1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 antibody or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1, or anti-PD-L1, therapeutic antibody or pathway-targeting agents or eribulin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to Dose Escalation or Dose Expansion Part 1, has received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CD137, or ziv-aflibercept?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-CTLA-4 have a minimum of 12 weeks elapsed from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapeutic antibody or pathway-targeting agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior exposure to immune-mediated therapy, including durvalumab and tremelimumab, except for NSCLC patients who are allowed anti-PD-1 or anti_PD-L1 therapy (including durvalumab)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior exposure to immune mediated therapy, including durvalumab and tremelimumab, except for anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy (including durvalumab) in NSCLC patients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody (including ipilimumab or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received anticancer antibodies within 4 weeks or radio or toxin immunoconjugates within 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has not received prior anti-PD-1 or ant-PD-L1 therapy after ACT and before study atezolizumab (MPDL3280A) administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with a Pi3 kinase inhibitor, anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with P13K/AKT/mTOR inhibitor and a checkpoint inhibitor (anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways) in combination?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior exposure to immune-mediated therapy, including durvalumab and tremelimumab, except for NSCLC/SCCHN/Bladder Cancer/cSCC patients who are allowed anti-PD-1 or anti_PD-L1 therapy (including durvalumab)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, or anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathway, for their current cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior PD-L1/PD-1/PD-L2 or EZH2 inhibitor therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 or anti-CTLA-4 has patient experienced: a toxicity that led to permanent discontinuation of prior immunotherapy, a  greater than or equal to grade 3 immune-related AE or an immune-related neurologic or ocular AE of any grade while receiving prior immunotherapy, or has required the use of additional immunosuppression other than corticosteroids for the management of an AE, has experienced recurrence of an AE if re-challenged, and currently require maintenance doses of more than 10 mg prednisone or equivalent per day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with PD-1, PD-L1 or PD-L2 inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2 agent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received Anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2, for a prior, unrelated, curatively-treated malignancy, within last 3 months of enrollment in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any previous treatment with a PD1 or PD-L1 inhibitor, including MEDI4736 (durvalumab) or tremelimumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with eribulin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the Doublet cohort and Triplet safety run-in phase, has patient received treatment with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2 or anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting immune checkpoint pathways?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 21 days elapsed since infusion of the last dose of antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received treatment with a combination of anti-PD-1/PD-L1 and anti-CTLA-4 inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4, was minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and greater than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the expansion phase, has patient received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, or anti-PD-L2 agent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab monotherapy arm and has had prior treatment with anti-PD-1, or anti-PD-L1 therapeutic antibody or pathway-targeting agents, are the following requirements and all other selection criteria met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4, anti-PD-1, or anti-PD-L1or other immune checkpoint inhibitor therapeutic antibodies or pathway-targeting agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the dose escalation cohort and has received prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 in MSI-H tumors, no grade 2 or more toxicities developed during that therapy requiring stopping immune checkpoint inhibition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 57
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with CD137 agonists or immune checkpoint blockade therapies, including anti-CTLA-1, anti-PD-1, or anti-PD-L1 therapeutic antibodies, If enrolled in the randomized arms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 58
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior antibody drug, was the drug conjugate such as sacituzumab govitecan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 59
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any of the following prior therapies: Prior FGFR inhibitors or PD-1/PD-L1 immune check point inhibitors for MIBC and/or  prior platinum chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 60
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior therapy with EGFR inhibitors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had prior treatment, for their current cancer, with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-LAG-3 or anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways within 1 year of study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 61
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the Phase 1 portion of study, has patient received prior anti-CTLA-4, anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 or other immune checkpoint inhibitor therapeutic antibodies or pathway-targeting agents?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.6.27 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002556. ak
